alert.note: Alert for Bradford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 5:43PM EDT until August 05 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Western Bradford. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canton, Troy, Ridgebury, Springfield, Sylvania, Wetona, Le Roy, Gillett, Grover, West Burlington, Alba, Leona, Cowley, Mount Pisgah State Park, Dunning, West Le Roy, Minnequa, Bentley Creek and Mosherville. Some creeks may experience quick rises, including South Creek and Towanda Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
